example.english: I'm feeling happy because I'm going to Cancun next week.
example.spanish: Me siento feliz porque la semana que viene voy a Cancún.

example.english: We painted our walls yellow, and I'm really happy with the result.
example.spanish: Pintamos las paredes de amarillo y estoy muy contento con el resultado.

example.english: I felt very sad when he left.
example.spanish: Me sentí muy triste cuando se marchó.

example.english: It was a sad mistake to buy this house.
example.spanish: Fue un error lamentable comprar esta casa.

example.english: The lake was hard as a rock after a week of freezing temperatures.
example.spanish: El lago estaba duro como una roca después de una semana de temperaturas heladas.

example.english: I couldn't sleep because the mattress was hard.
example.spanish: No pude dormir porque estaba duro el colchón.

example.english: My new cashmere blanket is so soft.
example.spanish: Mi nueva manta de cachemir es tan suave.

example.english: I have a bad back and I prefer soft mattresses.
example.spanish: Tengo la espalda mala y prefiero los colchones blandos.

example.english: That box is heavy. Lift with your legs!
example.spanish: Esa caja está pesada. ¡Usa tus piernas para levantarla!

example.english: Traffic was heavy in the morning.
example.spanish: La circulación de coches era densa por la mañana.

example.english: We danced by the light of the moon.
example.spanish: Bailamos a la luz de la luna.

example.english: Could you turn on the light, please?
example.spanish: ¿Podría encender la luz, por favor?

example.english: We hiked to the top of a high mountain to get a better view of the valley.
example.spanish: Caminamos hasta la cima de una montaña alta para tener una mejor vista del valle.

example.english: The airplane lost cabin pressure while flying at a high altitude.
example.spanish: La cabina del avión se despresurizó mientras volaba a gran altura.

example.english: The children's books are on a low shelf.
example.spanish: Los libros infantiles están en una repisa baja.

example.english: We received a very low amount of applications this year.
example.spanish: Recibimos una cantidad muy baja de solicitudes este año.

example.english: There is no reason to drive such a huge car if you're usually by yourself.
example.spanish: No hay ninguna razón de conducir un coche tan enorme si normalmente estás solo.

example.english: Your arms look huge! Have you been lifting weights?
example.spanish: ¡Tus brazos se ven inmensos! ¿Has estado levantando pesas?

example.english: Remember when it was cool to have a tiny cell phone?
example.spanish: ¿Recuerdas cuando estaba de moda tener un móvil minúsculo?

example.english: The tiny mosquito can do a great deal of harm.
example.spanish: El diminuto zancudo puede causar una gran cantidad de daño.

example.english: It is very kind of you to help me with my chores.
example.spanish: Es muy amable de tu parte ayudarme con mis tareas.

example.english: The staff of the hotel was very kind, constantly asking us if we needed anything.
example.spanish: El personal del hotel era muy atento y nos preguntaba constantemente si necesitábamos algo.

example.english: There was an unpleasant smell coming from the basement.
example.spanish: Un olor desagradable emanaba del sótano.

example.english: I don't like him at all. I find him to be an extremely unpleasant person.
example.spanish: Me cae muy mal. Me parece una persona extremadamente desagradable.

example.english: We danced by the light of the moon.
example.spanish: Bailamos a la luz de la luna.

example.english: Could you turn on the light, please?
example.spanish: ¿Podría encender la luz, por favor?

example.english: In Alaska it gets dark very early in the winter.
example.spanish: En Alaska se pone oscuro temprano en el invierno.

example.english: My favorite colors are dark blue and light blue.
example.spanish: Mis colores favoritos son el azul oscuro y el azul claro.

example.english: We have a long way to go before we get home.
example.spanish: Tenemos un camino largo por delante para llegar a casa.

example.english: The landing strip is a mile long.
example.spanish: La pista de aterrizaje mide una milla de largo.

example.english: I think these pants are too short.
example.spanish: Creo que este pantalón es demasiado corto.

example.english: He was short for his age.
example.spanish: Era bajo para su edad.

example.english: New fall fashion trends debuted at New York Fashion Week.
example.spanish: Las nuevas tendencias de moda para el otoño debutaron en la Semana de la Moda en Nueva York.

example.english: My brother bought himself a new bike.
example.spanish: Mi hermano se compró una bici nueva.

example.english: My old printer still works really well.
example.spanish: Mi vieja impresora sigue funcionando estupendamente.

example.english: I will be fifty years old tomorrow.
example.spanish: Mañana cumpliré cincuenta años.

example.english: There is an open container in the fridge.
example.spanish: Hay un contenedor abierto en la nevera.

example.english: The pieces are handy to reach when the game board is open for play.
example.spanish: Las fichas se pueden alcanzar fácilmente cuando el tablero está abierto para jugar.

example.english: If the door is closed, knock before going in.
example.spanish: Si la puerta está cerrada, llama antes de entrar.

example.english: The side lanes are going to be closed all month.
example.spanish: Los laterales van a estar cerrados todo el mes.

example.english: A polite lady always says "Thank you." - Yes, Grandma.
example.spanish: Una señorita educada siempre da las gracias. - Sí, abuelita.

example.english: Your children are so polite!
example.spanish: ¡Tus hijos son muy educados!

example.english: The man at the counter was very rude.
example.spanish: El hombre del mostrador fue muy maleducado.

example.english: Laura made some rude remarks about my weight.
example.spanish: Laura hizo unos comentarios groseros sobre mi peso.

example.english: Use precise words to avoid ambiguity and confusion.
example.spanish: Usa palabras precisas para evitar la ambigüedad y la confusión.

example.english: I don't know exactly what you mean. Can you be more precise?
example.spanish: No sé exactamente qué quieres decir. ¿Puedes ser más concreto?

example.english: I prefer to go to work early, because the office is quiet.
example.spanish: Prefiero entrar al trabajo temprano porque la oficina está silenciosa.

example.english: He has become a quiet man since his wife's death.
example.spanish: Se ha convertido en un hombre callado desde la muerte de su esposa.

example.english: My heart is restless without her near me.
example.spanish: Mi corazón está inquieto sin su presencia.

example.english: Shelly looked out at the restless sea that seemed to reflect how she was feeling.
example.spanish: Shelly miró hacia el mar agitado que parecía reflejar su estado emocional.

example.english: His grandfather was rich and left him a trust fund.
example.spanish: Su abuelo era rico y le dejó un fondo fiduciario.

example.english: The furniture looked rich and unmistakably French.
example.spanish: El mobiliario era suntuoso e inconfundiblemente francés.

example.english: She grew up in a poor family in Alabama.
example.spanish: Se crió en Alabama en el seno de una familia pobre.

example.english: The poor girl had to walk for several hours in the snow.
example.spanish: La pobre niña tuvo que andar varias horas en la nieve.

example.english: Who has the right answer for the next question?
example.spanish: ¿Quién tiene la respuesta correcta de la siguiente pregunta?

example.english: Are you sure this is the right street?
example.spanish: ¿Estás seguro que esta es la calle?

example.english: You will see the school on the left.
example.spanish: Verás la escuela a la izquierda.

example.english: I have always said that that reporter's views are far to the left.
example.spanish: Siempre he dicho que las opiniones de ese periodista son muy de la izquierda.

example.english: Keep your passport in a safe place.
example.spanish: Guarda el pasaporte en un lugar seguro.

example.english: The children were rescued from the burning building and are safe now.
example.spanish: Los niños fueron rescatados del edificio en llamas y ya están a salvo.

example.english: It's dangerous to play with fire.
example.spanish: Es peligroso jugar con fuego.

example.english: Esta receta simple solo requiere tres ingredientes y cinco minutos para preparar.
example.spanish: This easy recipe only requires three ingredients and five minutes to prepare.

example.english: Los pusieron a hacer problemas simples de suma.
example.spanish: They had them do simple addition problems.

example.english: My health insurance plan is too complex even for me, and I'm a doctor.
example.spanish: Mi plan de seguro médico es demasiado complejo aún para mí, y soy médico.

example.english: It's too complex to explain in five minutes.
example.spanish: Es demasiado complicado para explicar en cinco minutos.
